dcatCatalog.title: catalog of anomaly datasets
dcatCatalog.description: The catalog contains a set of datasets for anomaly detection. One dataset contains one anomaly type.

rights.value: The Creative Commons Attribution license allows re-distribution and re-use of a licensed work on the condition that the creator is appropriately credited. The material cannot be used for commercial purposes.

dataset.title: CloudSEN12 dataset
dataset.description: Mutli-temporal global dataset created to foster research in cloud and cloud shadow detection. The dataset contains three type of annotaions: high-quality (2000 ROI), scribble (2000 ROI) and no-annotation (5880 ROI). Each ROI contains 5 patches with different cloud covers: clear (0%), low-cloudy (1% - 25%), almost clear (25% - 45%), mid-cloudy (45% - 65%), cloudy (65% >).

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
Z_GIS (Salzburg, Austria)
FIGMMG (Lima, Peru)
the ISP (Valencia, Spain)
the aiPUCP (Lima, Peru).
dataset.scope: Cloud masks globally distributed and to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

tools: Intelligence foR Image Segmentation (IRIS) active learning software
procedure.scope: Labeling of all pixels with one of the four classes the full scene is classified.

method.label: High-quality labels
method.definition: Human photo-interpretation and use of IRIS with machine learning assistance.

method.label: Scribble labels
method.definition: Use of IRIS without machine learning assistance

method.label: No-annotation
method.definition: Manual annotation only in the clear image patch.

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed as 496 files in a tape archive file format (tar). Inside the archive each file is a GeoTIFF raster file.
distribution.title: cloudsen12 distribution

dataset.title: CESBIO dataset
dataset.description: Set of reference cloud mask data set generated by an active learning method for 38 Sentinel-2 scenes over 10 sites: Alta Floresta (Brazil), Arles (France), Ispra (Italy), Munich (Germany), Orleans (France), Gobabeb (Namibia), Marrakech (Morocco), Railroad Valley (USA), Pretoria (South AFrica) and Mongu (Zambia). The scenes are collected for different seasons and cloud cover types.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
CESBIO
CNES
dataset.scope: Cloud masks globally distributed and for the year 2017-2018. The data is to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

tools: Active Learning Cloud Detection (ALCD) software (source code available at https://github.com/CNES/ALCD)
procedure.scope: Labeling of all pixels with one of the four classes, the full scene is classified.

method.label: labels
method.definition: Active learning method based on the fact that a model trained on a small ensemble of well-chosen samples can performed as well as a model trained on a large ensemble of randomly-chosen samples. The method followed four main steps: compute the image features to provide to the classifier, select of a set of samples for all classes, after the first iteration select these samples where the classification confidence is low, train a random forest model with the samples, perform the classification with the model obtained. The process finishes when the classification is satisfactory.

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed in a TGZ file format (GZIP compressed TAR archive). Inside the archive each file is a GeoTIFF raster file. The dataset contains 2 folders: 'Reference_dataset' and 'Hollstein'. The 'Reference_dataset' folder contains 31 scenes and was used by the dataset creators for model training. The 'Hollstein' folder contains 7 scenes and was used for testing.
distribution.title: cesbio distribution

dataset.title: GSFC dataset
dataset.description: Reference cloud data over NASA GSFC for various cloud conditions from September 2017 to November 2018. The reference dataset is used for validating cloud masking algorithms for moderate spatial resolution satellite data (10-30m), namely Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: University of Maryland
NASA Goddard Space Fligth Center
dataset.dataSources: The cloud masks were provided by the university of Maryland and the NASA Goddard Space Fligth Center.
dataset.scope: Cloud masks over Goddard Space Fligth Center for 2017-2019, to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

tools: The ground-based images of the sky were collected using a smartphone camera with fisheye lens. Aerosol optical thickness (AOT) measured by the Aeronet station was checked in order to not mislabel potential thin clouds.
procedure.scope: Labeling of polygons within the image. The boundaries between clouds and clear classes was omitted (1-2 pixels).

method.label: labels
method.definition: Manual classification by experts using ground-based images of the sky, which were manually collected durinng the Sentinel-2 overpasses. To facilitate the labeling process, some ground-based images were manually geo-referenced to satellite imagery by manually selecting control points using the shape of clouds. Sentinel-2 images were presented in color and false color spectral combinations for labeling. When creating the cloud polygons, the boundaries between clouds and clear classes was omitted (1-2 pixels).

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed in a ZIP file format. Inside the archive each file is a ESRI Shapefile vector file.
distribution.title: gsfc distribution

rights.value: The Creative Commons Attribution license allows re-distribution and re-use of a licensed work on the condition that the creator is appropriately credited.

hasPolicy.value: You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use. accessService.description: The Data Service class provides a collection of operations that give access to the GSFC dataset.
creator: University of Maryland
NASA Goddard Space Fligth Center

endpointDescription.value: The dataset can be downloaded via the end-point.

dataset.title: Hollstein dataset
dataset.description: The S2 Hollstein dataset is a globally distributed database of manually labeled Sentinel-2 spectra of clouds.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences
publisher: GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences
dataset.scope: Labeled pixels are spread over the full globe and are associated to Sentinel-2 images acquired in 2016. The data is to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

procedure.scope: The images acquired for labeling are spread over the full globe.

method.label: labels
method.definition: The data was manually labeled (with polygons) using spectral tools and multiple false-color RGB views of a scene, as well as the spatial context. Each of the classes exhibit different spectral properties. For example, B10 at 1380nm shows a reflectance only for the cirrus class. The reflectance of the snow class decreases for B11 and B12, which is not the case for the cloud classes. The reflectance increases at the red edge for clear sky if the surface contains vegetation.

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed in a HDF5 file format (Hierarchical Data Format).
distribution.title: hollstein distribution

rights.value: The Creative Commons Attribution license allows re-distribution and re-use of a licensed work on the condition that the creator is appropriately credited. The material cannot be used for commercial purposes.

accessService.versionNotes: From V1 to V4 a new classification database was added, dates were corrected, Porduct_ID and Granule_ID were added, and a bug in the date format was fixed.

dataset.title: PixBox dataset
dataset.description: The PixBox-S2-CMIX dataset was used as a validation reference within the first Cloud Masking Inter-comparison eXercise (CMIX) conducted within the Committee Earth Observation Satellites (CEOS) Working Group on Calibration & Validation (WGCV) in 2019. The PixBox-S2-CMIX pixel collection was existing prior to CMIX and conducted already in 2018.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
Brockmann Consult GmbH
dataset.scope: The dataset is spatially, temporally (year 2018), and thematically well distributed. Samples are to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

procedure.scope: Label data are spatially, temporally, and thematically well distributed.

method.label: labels
method.definition: Trained experienced expert(s) manually classify pixels of an image sensor into a pre-defined detailed set of classes.

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed as 2 files in a ZIP file format: one ZIP file for the Sentinel-2 L1C images, one ZIP file for the pixel collection and description. In the archive the Sentinel-2 images are GeoTIFF files, while the label pixels are distributed as Delimited Text file (csv).
distribution.title: pixbox distribution

rights.value: The Creative Commons Attribution license allows re-distribution and re-use of a licensed work on the condition that the creator is appropriately credited.

hasPolicy.value: You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use. You may not apply legal terms or technological measures that legally restrict others from doing anything the license permits.

accessService.description: The Data Service class provides a collection of operations that give access to the PixBox dataset.
creator: ESA
Brockmann Consult GmbH

endpointDescription.value: The dataset (S2 L1C and pixel collection) can be downloaded via the end-point.

dataset.title: KappaZeta dataset
dataset.description: KappaZeta is a cloud mask dataset of 4403 labeled subscenes distributed over terrestrial Northern Europe from April to October 2020. For each month, ten products with stratus clouds, ten products with cumulus clouds and ten products with cirrus clouds were chosen (through active learning method by selecting worst performing sub-tiles after model inference) from different locations. To each label file is associated a Sentinel-2 L1C image. It was created to train the KappaMask model based on CNN.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
KappaZeta
University of Tartu Estonia
dataset.scope: The dataset is distributed uniformly over terrestrial Northern Europe for the time range April to October 2020. The data is to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

procedure.scope: Labeling of all pixels with one of the six classes, the full scene is classified.

method.label: CVAT_labels
method.definition: After a resampling of the sub-tiles into 10m resolution, the tiles were uploaded to CVAT for labelling. The labelling was peer-reviewed by labellers. CVAT is a free, open-source tool that can be used to create segmentation mask annotations, using polygon shapes.

method.label: segments.ai_labels
method.definition: Semi-automatic labeling based on an active learning approach which promotes the idea that a carefully selected subset of data will perform as good as a large dataset of random samples. Segments.ai platform supports model-assisted labelling and provides an active learning-based hand-annotated dataset. After a resampling of the sub-tiles into 10m resolution, the tiles were uploaded to Segments.AI for labelling. The labelling was peer-reviewed by labellers. Segments.ai has the ability to draw with brush, hence labels are smoother and less angular compared to CVAT.

distribution.description: The dataset is distributed in a ZIP format. Inside the archive each file is a NetCDF4 file.
distribution.title: kappazeta distribution

rights.value: The Creative Commons Attribution license allows re-distribution and re-use of a licensed work on the condition that the creator is appropriately credited.

hasPolicy.value: You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use. You may not apply legal terms or technological measures that legally restrict others from doing anything the license permits.

dataset.title: KappaSet dataset
dataset.description: KappaSet is a cloud mask dataset of 9251 labeled subscenes distributed over the full globe for the whole year 2020 (Winter, Spring, Summer and Autumn products). To each label file is associated a Sentinel-2 L1C image. It was created as an extension of the KappaZeta dataset (itself created to train the KappaMask model based on CNN).

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

University of Tartu Estonia

method.label: segments.ai_labels
method.definition: Semi-automatic labeling based on an active learning approach which promotes the idea that a carefully selected subset of data will perform as good as a large dataset of random samples. Segments.ai platform supports model-assisted labelling and provides an active learning-based hand-annotated dataset. After a resampling of the sub-tiles into 10m resolution, the tiles were uploaded to Segments.AI for labelling. The labelling was peer-reviewed by labellers. Segments.ai has the ability to draw with brush, hence labels are smoother and less angular compared to CVAT.

dataset.title: CESBIO_AI4QC dataset
dataset.description: Set of reference cloud mask data set generated by an active learning method for 30 Sentinel-2 scenes over 10 sites: Alta Floresta (Brazil), Arles (France), Ispra (Italy), Munich (Germany), Orleans (France), Gobabeb (Namibia), Marrakech (Morocco), Railroad Valley (USA), Pretoria (South AFrica) and Mongu (Zambia). The scenes are collected for different seasons and cloud cover types. The dataset is a smaller version of the CESBIO dataset, where the S2 L1C images have been added and the classes modified.

has-task.description: Semantic segmentation with a class assigned to each pixel.

creator: ESA
CESBIO
CNES
dataset.scope: Cloud masks globally distributed and for the year 2017-2018. The data is to be used for training of a ML model for automatic detection of clouds.

tools: Active Learning Cloud Detection (ALCD) software (source code available at https://github.com/CNES/ALCD)

method.label: labels
method.definition: Active learning method based on the fact that a model trained on a small ensemble of well-chosen samples can perform as well as a model trained on a large ensemble of randomly-chosen samples. The method followed four main steps: compute the image features to provide to the classifier, select of a set of samples for all classes, after the first iteration select these samples where the classification confidence is low, train a random forest model with the samples, perform the classification with the model obtained. The process finishes when the classification is satisfactory.

dataset.description: Reference cloud data over NASA GSFC for various cloud conditions from September 2017 to November 2018. The reference dataset is used for validating cloud masking algorithms for moderate spatial resolution satellite data, namely Sentinel-2. The dataset is a smaller version of the GSFC dataset, where S2 L1C images were added, the cloud masks reclassified and rastrized.
